Posts.Content: Blackhawk41 wrote: Hi All, Excuse my lack of understanding all the abbreviations on here. Total self proclaimed newbie. I felt quite well after my first lumpectomy/lymph node removal. Was walking decent distances by end of first week. Found out my margins weren’t all clear and had my second surgery this past Wednesday (exactly 2 weeks apart). Again, felt good next day. Not much pain but took Tylenol to stay ahead of it. Can’t take norcotics die to making me wired and too loopy. By the second night started feeling a pressure and heavy feeling with some sharp random pains at site. Surgeon used same incision site for 2nd excision. I had a few spots of blood? showing up on my soft ice packs and wondered if anyone has had this happen. I’m completely glued with internal sutures and have taken one shower so far. Maybe I did too much the first day after? I’ve been laying around most of today as gravity doesn’t seem to be my friend. Icing still since surgery on Wednesday. Tight supportive post surgical bra. Also developed a rash around lymph node site from what appears to be what they used to clean the site during second surgery. Thoughts or suggestions appreciated. Not so patiently waiting on pathologyfor clear margins as well. Dx 12/22/2017, DCIS, Left, 3cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+ Surgery 3/20/2018 Lumpectomy; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Surgery 4/4/2018 Lumpectomy: Left Surgery 4/19/2018 Lumpectomy: Left Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Not much pain ...at first Blackhawk41 Benaya
